content.title: Anticoagulation in Atrial Fibrillation
content.summary: Stroke prevention strategies using oral anticoagulants in patients with atrial fibrillation
key_points: DOACs preferred over warfarin (except mechanical valve/severe MS)
No role for aspirin monotherapy in AF stroke prevention
HAS-BLED assesses bleeding risk but rarely overrides anticoagulation
LAA occlusion for patients unable to take anticoagulation
Perioperative bridging rarely needed with DOACs

statement.text: Anticoagulation for AF stroke prevention is indicated based on CHA2DS2-VASc score (≥2 in men, ≥3 in women). Direct oral anticoagulants (DOACs) are preferred over warfarin for non-valvular AF due to superior efficacy, safety, and convenience. Warfarin remains indicated for mechanical heart valves and moderate-severe mitral stenosis.
statement.formal: AF Anticoagulation = CHA2DS2-VASc ≥2 (men) / ≥3 (women) → DOAC preferred → Warfarin if valve disease → LAA occlusion if OAC contraindicated

explanation.intuition: AF causes the atria to quiver rather than contract effectively, allowing blood to pool and clot, especially in the left atrial appendage. Anticoagulants prevent these clots from forming, reducing stroke risk by 60-70% compared to no treatment.
explanation.key_insight: CHA2DS2-VASc identifies who needs anticoagulation, not who is safe without it. Even a score of 1 in men warrants consideration. Bleeding risk (HAS-BLED) helps optimize modifiable factors but rarely justifies withholding anticoagulation.

definitions_glossary.DOAC: Direct oral anticoagulant - inhibits factor Xa (apixaban, rivaroxaban, edoxaban) or thrombin (dabigatran)
definitions_glossary.warfarin: Vitamin K antagonist requiring INR monitoring
definitions_glossary.CHA2DS2_VASc: Stroke risk score: CHF, HTN, Age≥75 (2), DM, Stroke (2), Vascular, Age 65-74, Sex female
definitions_glossary.HAS_BLED: Bleeding risk score: HTN, Abnormal renal/liver, Stroke, Bleeding history, Labile INR, Elderly, Drugs/alcohol
definitions_glossary.INR: International normalized ratio - measure of warfarin anticoagulation intensity
definitions_glossary.non_valvular_AF: AF without mechanical valve or moderate-severe mitral stenosis
definitions_glossary.LAA_occlusion: Device (Watchman) or surgical closure of left atrial appendage
definitions_glossary.time_in_therapeutic_range: Percentage of time INR is 2-3 on warfarin; goal >70%
definitions_glossary.reversal_agent: Specific antidote: idarucizumab for dabigatran, andexanet al.fa for Xa inhibitors
definitions_glossary.stroke_risk: Annual stroke rate without anticoagulation; varies by CHA2DS2-VASc
definitions_glossary.major_bleeding: Life-threatening, symptomatic critical organ, or Hgb drop ≥2g/dL
definitions_glossary.intracranial_hemorrhage: Most feared bleeding complication; DOACs have lower ICH risk than warfarin

pathophysiology.thrombus_formation: Atrial stasis (Virchow's triad element) + endothelial dysfunction + hypercoagulable state → LAA thrombus → embolization → stroke

anticoagulation_mechanism.warfarin: Inhibits vitamin K-dependent clotting factors (II, VII, IX, X)
anticoagulation_mechanism.factor_Xa_inhibitors: Apixaban, rivaroxaban, edoxaban - block factor Xa directly

CHA2DS2_VASc_scoring.V: Vascular disease - prior MI, PAD, aortic plaque (1 point)

anticoagulation_thresholds.men: ≥2 = OAC recommended; 1 = consider OAC; 0 = no OAC
anticoagulation_thresholds.women: ≥3 = OAC recommended; 2 = consider OAC; 1 = no OAC (female sex alone)

HAS_BLED_scoring.A: Abnormal renal or liver function (1 point each)

apixaban.dose: 5mg BID (2.5mg BID if 2 of: age ≥80, weight ≤60kg, Cr ≥1.5)
apixaban.trial: ARISTOTLE: superior to warfarin for stroke and major bleeding
apixaban.advantages: Best bleeding profile, BID dosing, renal-friendly

rivaroxaban.advantages: Once daily, take with food for absorption

dabigatran.dose: 150mg BID (110mg BID in Europe for elderly/bleeding risk)
dabigatran.trial: RE-LY: 150mg superior for stroke, 110mg similar efficacy/less bleeding

edoxaban.dose: 60mg daily (30mg if CrCl 15-50, weight ≤60kg, or with P-gp inhibitor)

warfarin.target_INR: 2.0-3.0 for AF; 2.5-3.5 for mechanical mitral valve

LAA_occlusion.indication: High stroke risk + contraindication to long-term anticoagulation

definition.@value: Risk stratification and oral anticoagulant selection for stroke prevention in atrial fibrillation

learning_objectives: Calculate CHA2DS2-VASc score and determine anticoagulation indication
Compare DOACs and select appropriate agent
Identify indications for warfarin over DOACs
clinical_pearls: Aspirin alone does NOT adequately prevent stroke in AF - use OAC
Female sex alone (CHA2DS2-VASc = 1) doesn't require anticoagulation
Apixaban has best bleeding profile - consider in high bleeding risk
DOACs contraindicated in mechanical valves and severe MS
Most procedures don't require bridging with DOACs - just hold
